alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Borden; Central Brewster County; Chinati Mountains; Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Dawson; Eastern Culberson County; Ector; Gaines; Glasscock; Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet; Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains; Howard; Loving; Marfa Plateau; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Scurry; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor; Winkler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 01 at 1:36PM CDT until April 04 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IS IN EFFECT FOR MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 10% OR LESS, 20FT WINDS OF 25 MPH OR MORE, AND VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND MOST OF WEST TEXAS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IS IN EFFECT FOR TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 10% OR LESS, 20FT WINDS OF 30 MPH OR MORE, AND VERY HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND MOST OF WEST TEXAS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IS IN EFFECT FOR MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 10% OR LESS, 20FT WINDS OF 25 MPH OR MORE, AND VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND MOST OF WEST TEXAS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IS IN EFFECT FOR TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 10% OR LESS, 20FT WINDS OF 30 MPH OR MORE, AND VERY HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND MOST OF WEST TEXAS... * AFFECTED AREA...Gaines, Dawson, Borden, Scurry, Andrews, Martin, Howard, Mitchell, Loving, Winkler, Ector, Midland, Glasscock, Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains, Chaves Plains, Eddy Plains, Lea, Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet, Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains, Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor, Eastern Culberson County, Chinati Mountains, Marfa Plateau, Davis Mountains, Davis Mountains Foothills and Central Brewster County. * TIMING...The first watch is for Monday morning through Monday evening. The second watch is for Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * WINDS...Southwest 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 70 mph. Higher winds expected in the mountains. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 3 percent. * RFTI...8 to 9 or extreme. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions will have the potential to grow quickly into dangerous wind-driven wildfires.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
